metadata.title: CVE-2018-1305 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Security constraints defined by annotations of Servlets in Apache Tomcat9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.4, 8.5.0 to 8.5.27, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.49 and 7.0.0 to 7.0.84were only applied once a Servlet had been loaded. Because securityconstraints defined in this way apply to the URL pattern and any URLs belowthat point, it was possible - depending on the order Servlets were loaded -for some security constraints not to be applied. This could have exposedresources to users who were not authorised to access them.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1305` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.6
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.6
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.6
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.6
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.6
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.6
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
tomcat8 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1.6').
